title: Publications
text:
Below is a complete list of my publications.




References

Algorithmic thresholds in combinatorial optimization depend on the time scalingAngelini, M., Avila-GonzÃ¡lez, M., Dâ€™Amico, F., Machado, D., Mulet, R., & Ricci-Tersenghi, F.2025. arXiv preprint arXiv:2504.11174TL;DR: We studied the scaling behaviour with training time of algorithmic thresholds of simulated Annealing algorithm in k-SAT and Q-col problems.


Implicit bias produces neural scaling laws in learning curves, from perceptrons to deep networksDâ€™Amico, F., Bocchi, D., & Negri, M.2025. arXiv preprint arXiv:2505.13230TL;DR: We show with a simple Perceptron theory how the norm of a model can be used as a useful parameter to predict its scaling laws. We show with extensive simulations that also deep-networks in real datasets classification show the same behavior.


Pseudo-likelihood produces associative memories able to generalize, even for asymmetric couplingsDâ€™Amico, F., Bocchi, D., Del Bono, L. M., Rossi, S., & Negri, M.2025. arXiv preprint arXiv:2507.05147TL;DR: We studied pseudo-likelihood training in an analitically tractable model. We show why it behaves as an associative memory and that during training time it interpolates between already known learning rules. We show that such model is capable of generalization and that it works even if couplings are not symmetric.


Statistical mechanics of vector hopfield network near and above saturationNicoletti, F., Dâ€™Amico, F., & Negri, M.2025. arXiv preprint arXiv:2507.02586TL;DR: We studied the Vector Hopfield network with Hebb couplings in arbitrary number of dimensions, computing the equilibrium phase diagram and discovering an out-of-equilibrium denoising behaviour absent in standard hopfield model.


Self-attention as an attractor network: Transient memories without backpropagationDâ€™Amico, F., & Negri, M.2024. 2024 IEEE workshop on complexity in engineering (COMPENG), 1â€“6TL;DR: We show that a simplified self-attention model trained directly via pseudo-likelihood minimization behaves as an associative memory at the very first step of dynamics.

title: About
text:
Hello! I am Francesco Dâ€™Amico, a PhD student in Physics at Sapienza University of Rome, where I work under the supervision of Matteo Negri and Chiara Cammarota on the topic of statistical theory of learning.
My research lies at the intersection of statistical mechanics, machine learning, and complex systems.

title: About
text:
Research Interests

Data structure in machine learning and neural scaling laws.
Associative memories and attention-class architectures

Effects of approximating likelihood in energy-based models

Optimization and inference in hard computational tasks
